document_metadata.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist 64627 alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: In organotypic hippocampal slices, both proaggregant and antiaggregant Tau is missorted to the somatodendritic compartment as has been shown before (Fig. 1 A and B, asterisks)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: MC-1–positive Tau accumulates in the axonal grains of proaggregant Tau as described above (arrowheads), whereas antiaggregant slices remain unstained

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Proaggregant Tau transgenic slices showed a significant reduction of spines compared with littermate control slices, whereas spine density of antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices was similar to controls (Fig. 3 A and B)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: This suggests that the energy status of the neurons is compromised by proaggregant but not by antiaggregant Tau

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: We observed a typical paired-pulse facilitation (PPF) response in littermate controls and antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices, whereas in proaggregant Tau transgenic slices, the same stimulus paradigm resulted in a paired-pulse depression (Fig. 4B)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: The axonal density of mitochondria, which is slightly lower in proaggregant compared with antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices, is marginally decreased by 64627 treatment albeit in a genotype-independent manner (Fig. S7)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: In organotypic hippocampal slices, both proaggregant and antiaggregant Tau is missorted to the somatodendritic compartment as has been shown before (Fig. 1 A and B, asterisks)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: In organotypic hippocampal slices, both proaggregant and antiaggregant Tau is missorted to the somatodendritic compartment as has been shown before (Fig. 1 A and B, asterisks)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: In organotypic hippocampal slices, both proaggregant and antiaggregant Tau is missorted to the somatodendritic compartment as has been shown before (Fig. 1 A and B, asterisks)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Only proaggregant Tau transgenic slices reveal Taupositive beaded structures in the neuropil oriented mostly perpendicular to the apical dendrites of the CA1 pyramidal cells (Fig. 1 C and D, arrowheads) resembling grains in human AGD (16)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: This suggests that proaggregant Tau accumulates in the axons as grains

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: The axons of transfected neurons (Fig. 1 G and I) clearly reveal small inclusions of Tau (∼1 μm in size, arrowheads), although presynaptic boutons (e.g., giant mossy fiber boutons) are only marginally stained for Tau (Fig. 1I and Fig. S2 A and B; arrow), indicating that Tau does not accumulate at presynaptic boutons in these slices

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: We also observed that Tau missorts into a subgroup of proximal dendrites, which correlates with a dramatic spine loss in the affected dendrites (Fig. S2 C and F)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Proaggregant Tau transgenic slices showed a significant reduction of spines compared with littermate control slices, whereas spine density of antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices was similar to controls (Fig. 3 A and B)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: By contrast, dendrites that do not contain Tau are richly decorated with spines (>1 spines per μm), indicating that there is only local impairment of dendritic function in case of proaggregant Tau missorting

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: MC-1–positive Tau accumulates in the axonal grains of proaggregant Tau as described above (arrowheads), whereas antiaggregant slices remain unstained

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: We determined mitochondrial movements in live organotypic slices because aggregation-prone Tau is known to impair mitochondrial transport (Fig. 3 D and E)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Mitochondria transport is similar in both kinds of Tau transgenic slices (Fig. 3E) with only a moderately lower mitochondrial density in proaggregant Tau transgenic slices compared with antiaggregant slices (Fig. 3F and Table S2)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: ATP is reduced in the proaggregant transgenic slices, matching the lower mitochondrial density, compared with littermate controls or antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices (Fig. 3H)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: The axonal density of mitochondria, which is slightly lower in proaggregant compared with antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices, is marginally decreased by 64627 treatment albeit in a genotype-independent manner (Fig. S7)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: ATP is reduced in the proaggregant transgenic slices, matching the lower mitochondrial density, compared with littermate controls or antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices (Fig. 3H)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: This suggests that the energy status of the neurons is compromised by proaggregant but not by antiaggregant Tau

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Adenosine downmodulates neuronal activity (cFos levels), impairs the presynapse, and attenuates long-term potentiation (LTP) via the A1 receptor (21)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: 64627 increases neuronal activity (Fos mRNA) both in proaggregant Tau transgenic slices and controls, although in case of the proaggregant slices neuronal activity is almost doubled, yielding levels similar to those of treated littermate control slices (Fig. 4D)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: In line with these observations, the presynaptic impairment in proaggregant Tau transgenic slices can be reversed by 64627 or BSc3094 without causing adverse effects in controls (Fig. 4F and Fig. S6)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Indeed, the reduced level of spines seen in proaggregant Tau transgenic slices are normalized when treated with 64627, whereas no significant changes are found in antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices or littermate controls (Fig. 5 A and B)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Having observed that 64627 restores presynaptic functioning (i.e., PPF, Fig. 4F), neuronal activity (induction of Fos, Fig. 4D), and dendritic spine levels in proaggregant Tau transgenic organotypic slices (Fig. 5 A and B), we tested whether we could restore long-term spatial memory in proaggregant Tau transgenic mice as well

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: 64627 reestablished novel arm preference in proaggregant mice, suggesting that 64627 restores spatial memory in these animals

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: 64627 treatment improved long-term object recognition memory in proaggregant Tau transgenic mice, as shown by increased novel object preference

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: This result suggests an impaired learning association between the sound and the foot shock in proaggregant mice, which can be rescued by 64627 treatment

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Compared with untreated proaggregant Tau transgenic mice, treated mice (proaggregant Tau transgenics and littermate controls) have significantly larger maximal excitatory postsynaptic potential amplitudes (Fig. 5 G–I)

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Treatment with 64627 increases the slope of the I/O curve in both proaggregant Tau transgenic slices and littermate controls (Fig. 5I).

citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.name: Adenosine A1 receptor antagonist rolofylline alleviates axonopathy caused by human Tau ΔK280.

links.evidence: Indeed, the reduced level of spines seen in proaggregant Tau transgenic slices are normalized when treated with 64627, whereas no significant changes are found in antiaggregant Tau transgenic slices or littermate controls (Fig. 5 A and B)
